definition[0]: (1925â€“2014) a British politician in the Labour Party, known for his strong left-wing opinions. He inherited the title of Viscount Stansgate, but he gave up his title so that he could become a member of the House of Commons. He was a minister in the Labour governments of the 1960s and 1970s, and his political diaries (diary ) provide a detailed description of political life in the UK. He retired from Parliament in 2001.
